roboRallyPackage
Class Board

java.lang.Object
  roboRallyPackage.Terminatable
      roboRallyPackage.Board

public class Board
extends Terminatable

A class representing a game board.

Version:
24 may 2012
Author:
Jonas Schouterden (r0260385) & Nele Rober (r0262954) Bachelor Ingenieurswetenschappen, KULeuven
Invariants:
  • A Board must have a valid width.
        this.canHaveAsWidth(this.getWidth())
  • A Board must have a valid height.
        this.canHaveAsHeight(this.getHeight())
  • An element that is placed on a Board must have a valid position.
        for each element in this.getElements(Element.class): this.isValidPositionOnBoard(element.getPosition())
  • An element that is placed on a Board must have that Board as attribute.
        for each element in this.getElements(Element.class): element.getBoard() == this
  • An element that is placed on a Board may not be terminated
        for no element in this.getElements(Element.class): element.isTerminated()
  • A terminated Board is not allowed to contain elements or to change its state.
        if(this.isTerminates()) then this.getElements(Elements.class) == null

    Constructor Detail

    Board

    public Board(long width,
             long height)
    Constructs a Board with the given width and height. If these given width and height are not valid values, the width and the height will both be set to 10.

    Parameters:
    width - The width for this new Board.
    height - The height for this new Board.
    Postconditions:
  • ...
        if (canHaveAsWidth(width))
         then (new this).getWidth() == width
        else (new this).getWidth() == 10
  • ...
        if (canHaveAsWidth(width))
         then (new this).getHeight() == height
        else (new this).getHeight() == 10
    • Method Detail

    getFirstElementStartingAt

    public Element getFirstElementStartingAt(Position position,
                                         Orientation orientation)
                                  throws java.lang.NullPointerException
    Returns an element placed on this board on the first position one encounters while moving forward in a straight line starting from the given position with the given orientation. When multiple elements are placed on the first encountered position, only one of these elements is returned. The choice of which element to be returned happens semi-randomly. When no elements are found when 'you have reached the end of this Board', this method will return 'null'.

    Parameters:
    position - The position to start from
    orientation - The direction where the other position may lie, respectively to the current position (up, down,...).
    Returns:
    ...
        for each i in 1..Long.MAX_VALUE:
         if(! (this.getElements(position.getNeighbourAt(orientation, i)) == null))
            then for one element in this.getElements(position.getNeighbourAt(orientation, i)) | result == element
    Returns:
    Returns null when no element is found.
        for each i in 1..Long.MAX_VALUE:
         if((this.getElements(position.getNeighbourAt(orientation, i)) == null))
            then result == null
    Throws:
    java.lang.NullPointerException - [CAN] ...
        position == null || orientation == null

    removeElement

    public void removeElement(Element element)
                   throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                          java.lang.IllegalStateException
    Removes a given element from this Board if it is placed on this board. The board of this element will be set null, the position of this element is not changed.

    Parameters:
    element - The element that will be removed from this board.
    Postcondition:
    ...
        ! this.getElements(Element).contains(element)
    Effect:
    ...
        element.setBoard(null)
    Throws:
    NullpointerException - [CAN] ...
        element == null
    java.lang.IllegalStateException - [CAN] ...
        element.getBoard() != this
    java.lang.NullPointerException

    putElement

                       Element newElement)
                throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                       java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                       IllegalPositionException,
                       IllegalBoardException,
                       IllegalElementCombinationException
    Places a given element on this board on a given position if this element can be placed there.

    Parameters:
    position - The position where this element has to be placed.
    newElement - The element that will be placed on this board.
    Postcondition:
    ...
        if(canElementBePutAtPosition(position, newElement)) then (new this).getElements(Element).contains(newElement)
    Effects:
  • ...
        newElement.setPosition(position)
  • ...
        if(canElementBePutAtPosition(position, newElement)) then newElement.setBoard(this)
    • Throws:

        newElement == null

    moveElement

    public void moveElement(Position position,
                        Element element)
                 throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                        java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                        IllegalPositionException,
                        IllegalBoardException,
                        IllegalElementCombinationException
    Moves a given element from one place on this board to another place on this board if possible. When the element is already standing on that position, nothing happens.

    Parameters:
    position - The position where this element has to be placed.
    element - The element that has to be moved
    Effect:
    ...
        if(this.canElementBePutAtPosition(position, element) && element.getPosition() != position) then this.removeElement(element) && this.putElement(element)
    Throws:
    java.lang.NullPointerException - [CAN] ...
        element == null
    java.lang.IllegalStateException - [CAN] ...
        element.isTerminated()
    IllegalPositionException - [CAN] ...
        ! this.canElementBePutAtPosition(position, element)
    IllegalBoardException - [CAN] ...
        !this.getElements(Element.class).contains(element) || ! this.canElementBePutAtPosition(position, element)
    IllegalElementCombinationException - [CAN] ...
        ! this.canElementBePutAtPosition(position, element)

    canElementBePutAtPosition

    public boolean canElementBePutAtPosition(Position position,
                                         Element element,
                                         java.util.Map<Position,java.util.Set<Element>> elements)
                                  throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                         IllegalPositionException,
                                         IllegalBoardException,
                                         IllegalElementCombinationException
    Returns whether the given element can be placed on this board at the given position with the given set of elements.

    Parameters:
    position - The position where the new element may have to be placed.
    element - The element that may have to be placed on this board.
    elements - The set of elements that is already placed on this board
    Returns:
    ...
        result == isValidPositionOnBoard(position)
    Returns:
    ...
        result == (element.getBoard() == null)
    Returns:
    ...
        if for each oldElement in elements.get(position): oldElement.canSharePositionWith(element) then result == true
    Throws:
    java.lang.NullPointerException - [CAN] ...
        element == null || elements == null
    IllegalPositionException - [CAN] ...
        ! isValidPositionOnBoard(position)
    IllegalBoardException - [CAN] ...
        element.getBoard() != null && element.getBoard() != this
    IllegalElementCombinationException - [CAN] ...
        for some oldElement in this.getElements(position):
           ! oldElement.canSharePositionWith(element)

    merge

    public void merge(Board other)
           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
    Merges a given board with this board. This means that all the elements of the given board are moved to this board if possible, otherwise they are terminated. The other board is also terminated at the end.

    Parameters:
    other - The other board that has to be merged with this board.
    Postcondition:
    ...
        for each position in this.getMergePositionsOfElements(other).keySet():
          for each element in this.getMergePositionsOfElements(other).get(position):
           (new this).getElements(position).contains(element)
    Effect:
    ...
        other.terminate()
    Throws:
    IllegalStateExceptions - [CAN] ...
        this.isTerminated() || other.isTerminated()
    java.lang.IllegalStateException

    createListVertices

    public java.util.List<OrientatedPosition> createListVertices(Robot robot)
                                                      throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
    Returns a list of orientatedPositions that are approximately reachable by this robot. This means that he may have enough energy to reach it. All the orientatedPostions that are not in the list, are either not reachable (the robot certainly has not enough energy to reach it) or the robot cannot be placed there (e.g. there is a wall there)

    Parameters:
    robot - The robot for which to calculate the list of vertices.
    Returns:
    ...
        for each orientatedPosition in OrientatedPosition:
          result.contains(orientatedPosition)
         || orientatedPosition.getPosition().getManhattanDistance(robot.getPosition()) >= robot.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND)/robot.getTotalCostToMove()
          || this.canElementBePutAtPosition(orientatedPosition.getPosition(),robot)
    Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalStateException - [CAN]
        robot.getBoard() != this || robot.isTerminated()

    createDiGraphForRobot

    public EdgeWeightedDigraph createDiGraphForRobot(Robot robot)
                                          throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
    Creates an EdgeWeightedDigraph for the given robot. This means that all the vertices from this.createListVertices(robot) and all the valid connections (edges) between them are included.

    Parameters:
    robot - The robot to calculate the edgeWeightedDigraph for.
    Returns:
    ...
        result.V() == this.createListVertices(robot).size()
    Returns:
    ...
        result.edges() == this.createEdges(robot)
    Returns:
    ...
        for each vertexNR in 0..this.createListVertices(robot).size():
         for each edge in result.adj(vertexNR):
           edge.from() == vertexNR
    Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalStateException - [CAN]
        robot.getBoard() != this || robot.isTerminated()
